Method Detail

traceExceptionSource

public static org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException traceExceptionSource(org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryConnection conn,
                                                                              org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException ex,
                                                                              java.lang.String additionalInfo)
Trace the exception source within the exceptions to identify the originating endpoint. The message of the provided exception is adapted to "@ endpoint.getId() - %orginalMessage".

Note that in addition HTTP error codes are extracted from the title, if the exception resulted from an HTTP error, such as for instance "503 Service unavailable"

Parameters:
conn - the connection to identify the the endpoint
ex - the exception
additionalInfo - additional information that might be helpful, e.g. the subquery
Returns:
a modified exception with endpoint source

repairConnection

public static void repairConnection(org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryConnection conn,
                                    java.lang.Exception ex)
                             throws FedXQueryException,
                                    FedXRuntimeException
Walk the stack trace and in case of SocketException repair the connection of the particular endpoint.

Parameters:
conn - the connection to identify the endpoint
ex - the exception
Throws:
FedXRuntimeException - if the connection could not be repaired
FedXQueryException

getExceptionString

public static java.lang.String getExceptionString(java.lang.String msg,
                                                  java.lang.Exception ex)
Return the exception in a convenient representation, i.e. '%msg% (%CLASS%): %ex.getMessage()%'

Parameters:
msg -
ex -
Returns:
the exception in a convenient representation

changeExceptionMessage

public static <E extends java.lang.Exception> E changeExceptionMessage(java.lang.String msgPrefix,
                                                                       E ex,
                                                                       java.lang.Class<E> exClazz)
If possible change the message text of the specified exception. This is only possible if the provided exception has a public constructor with String and Throwable as argument. The new message is set to 'msgPrefix. ex.getMessage()', all other exception elements remain the same.

Type Parameters:
E -
Parameters:
msgPrefix -
ex -
exClazz -
Returns:
